      • getMinCostPath3D

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getMinCostPath3D(int[] startPoint,
                                                   int[] endPoint,
                                                   boolean[] analysisCh,
                                                   int frame,
                                                   int xyExtension,
                                                   int zExtension)
        Retrieve the minimum cost path between startPoint and endPoint. The cost map is a crop of the original image wrapping around the startPoint and endPoint. The cost of each pixel is weighted by intensity and color distance to the average color of startPoint and endPoint
        Parameters:
        startPoint -
        endPoint -
        analysisCh -
        frame -
        xyExtension -
        zExtension -
        Returns:

      • getPtIntColor

        public float[] getPtIntColor(int[] point,
                             boolean[] analysisCh,
                             int frame)
        Get intensity and normalized color at a point.
        Parameters:
        point - X, Y, Z coordinates in center[0], center[1], center[2]
        analysisCh -
        frame - current composite image frame
        Returns:
        intensity (ptIntColor[0]) and the normalized color (ptIntColor[i])

      • getWinMeanIntColor

        public float[] getWinMeanIntColor(int[] centerPt,
                                  boolean[] analysisCh,
                                  int frame,
                                  int xyRadius,
                                  int zRadius)
        Get mean intensity and normalized color in a search window of (xyRadius*2+1, xyRadius*2+1, zRadius*2+1)
        Parameters:
        centerPt - X, Y, Z coordinates in center[0], center[1], center[2]
        analysisCh -
        frame - current composite image frame
        xyRadius - X-Y radius of the average window
        zRadius - Z radius of the average window
        Returns:
        mean intensity (meanIntColor[0]) and the normalized mean color (meanIntColor[i])

        public float[] getWeightedAVeIntColor(float[] intColorA,
                                      float[] intColorB,
                                      float weightA)
        Calculate the weighted average intensity and color of two inputs.
        Parameters:
        intColorA - intensity and color of point A
        intColorB - intensity and color of point B
        weightA - the weight of point A in weighted average calculation
        Returns:
        weighted average intensity and color
